intro: Cooperia drummondii var. chlorosolen, commonly known as the yellow cooperia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
